description:
tl;dr amazing sandwich spot for quick, casual lunches when you don't feel like going anywhere far.

My boyfriend and I used to live in Bayview, and I swear the ONLY good things about that place were the small businesses around, one of them being a convenience store and deli. When we moved to the sunset, I didn't think we'd be so close to one of those, until we found Gene's! Gene's is even better, in my opinion.

But yeah, I assume the guy who's always there is Gene, and you watch him make your sandwich. It seems like a lot of people who go there are regulars. Gene is friendly but not at all annoying or overbearing.

The sandwiches are HUGE, the bread is nice, and there are all the fixins for subs without being really expensive. Also, as a side note, I asked for extra cheese on my sandwich and Gene(?) is one of the only people I've ever ordered a sandwich from who actually puts EXTRA cheese and not just one little half slice on a gigantic sub. The secret sauce is also really good--it's like an Italian dressing but seems to me like it's more suited for a sub than a salad since it didn't make the sub overly soggy or weird. My boyfriend usually gets the atomic sub, and it's great for people who love meat.

So excited to have found my new go-to convenience store/sandwich place!
author: Claire C.

description:
Large atomic sub. That's it. That's all you need.

It's a decent sized sammich and it doesn't hurt your wallet. I always get the large so I can save the other half for later. The secret sauce they have in it is like a dressing and has a nice acidic taste. Been going here since high school and I'll always come back.
author: Marie C.

description: Been coming here for about 15 years. The sandwiches never disappoint. Can't go wrong with any of them but the atomic in particular is great. Convenient location and hours. One of my favorite sandwiches in SF.
author: Henry K.

description:
This sandwich does NOT follow the Little Lucca / Roxie's sandwich formula consisting of a hearty helping of meat (and everything else) on Dutch crunch bread. The amount of meat is seriously underwhelming, however the rest of the sandwich comes together very nicely. I'm usually a fan of cold sandwiches, a la hero subs of NYC, and this sandwich reminds me of just that (soft roll, oil / vinegar), only heavily toasted.

The picture below shows an atomic sub, made of three meats. There are 1-2 slices of each meat, making the meat flavor simply a complement of other flavors in the sandwich, rather than the focal point. For the price, this felt like a scam. But, the sandwich does set itself out from the rest due to it's unique flavor, which is heavily driven by oil / vinegar, mayo, and onions. Skip this sandwich if you don't like these profiles, or if you don't enjoy heavily toasted, flaky bread. Ordering these cold is just not worth it.

Homeboy behind the counter is super cool, and I whole heartedly recommend giving him your business. Times are tough, rent is high, so I'm not trippin' too hard about a couple slices of deli meat.
author: Douglas Y.

description:
I've been getting sandwiches with Gene and the crew for more than a decade now, since before high school. I've been meaning to write my gratitude for a while. The folks behind the counter have worked very hard throughout the years, and I have grown to consider them as part of my neighborhood family. Gene's sandwiches still have the same amazing taste since my first visit - the secret sauce promises a satisfying sour tangy kick. 

Of course, being a corner store, they carry a nice variety of snacks, ice cream, sodas, wine, beer, heavier liquors, canned foods, cooking ingredients, and a few essential items by the window. They also are selling Gene's Liquor merchandise now! I've bought a t-shirt myself! 

If you're around the area, do pay Gene's a visit for an excellent sandwich experience. If you really want to treat yourself, I highly recommend the Atomic Sub (turkey, pastrami, corned beef) with added avocado, jalapenos, two strips of bacon, and extra cheese (please). One sandwich is usually ready under 10 minutes.
author: Johnathan W.

description: Great sandwiches. Hamik does a great job every time.  Break is always fresh and tasty
author: mick R.

description: From the outside, you would not know it but this is a gem of a location for Irish and UK expats looking for a fix of their fav foods from home everything from potato crisps to soda, chocolate bars to biscuits canned foods to sausages and Back Bacon you name it this place seems to have it and if there is something you are looking for that they do not have just let them know and they will get it for you. Their prices are very good compared to some of their compeditors.
author: Frank B.

description: If you live in the neighborhood and have not/don't go to Gene's, you might need to re-evaluate your life choices. As someone who has grown up in the City, I can honestly say it is HARD to find a place that reminds me of what it was like growing up. Thanks for reminding me of "the simpler days" with a sandwich and some neighborhood vibes.
author: Tyler D.

description: Best turkey sandwich in the city!! The staff is really nice and helpful.  Go to Gene's liquor ASAP!
author: Michele R.

description:
The absolute best sandwich in the city.
They also carry lots of non-standard snacks, and will order you just about any alcohol you could want.
Stand up guys, drop in and get a bite to eat.
author: Lauren C.

description: Good and satisfying vegetarian sandwiches are hard to find, but Gene's is a really good one! This is my go to place for sandwiches after a busy weekday and it sure will not disappoint you. I wish it opened up before I hop the muni for work, it would have become by go-to breakfast sandwich too!
author: Shruti B.

description:
Gene's was of my favorite lunch spots back in high school; we ate there far too often. On Saturday, I found myself back in the neighborhood and decided to grab a sandwich and see if the magic was still there. It was!! The Gene's experience was just as wonderful as it had been back in the day. Don't let the initial appearance dissuade you. Yes, it is a liquor store. But damn, do they make incredible sandwiches!! The same two guys have been working there for years and they are always in good spirits. 

They have a long list of sandwich options, although nothing too crazy or fancy. But really, when your secret sauce is that delicious, why overdo it? I always get a regular turkey with everything except onion, plus avocado. You really can't do wrong with an order like that. Their sandwiches are toasty, crispy, messy, and freaking delicious. Id' like to think of myself as quite the sandwich experience, and I think they make some of the best sandwiches in the city. They have a good drink and snack selection as well. Really the only thing missing is place to sit and eat, but with the various nearby parklets (as well as Ocean Beach), it's not that big of a deal.

The price is right, the sandwiches are filling and delicious, and the wait is never super long.
author: Regina L.

description:
Gene's has definitely stood the tests of time since my day-drinking afternoons as a young adult, but this place is awesome. Accessible by most points in the city via the L or Sunset/19th Ave. Bus lines, quick service, personable atmosphere, and there' s a 7/11 across the street if you like Slurpees.

Sizeable subs at more than affordable prices. Quite enjoy the spicy sauce (probably something simple but has me fooled) as well as the portions, everything feels just right and it's not one of those sando experiences where the damn thing gloops onto your lap. 

Favs are the Tuna and the Atomic Sub, both compliment the sauce.

Plus the customer/cook side-comments are always great to listen to, lot of fun asides to hear, and the jocularity never sounds mean.
author: First Name L.

description:
Lines are long most of the time and the guys don't work at lightning fast speed but they're super nice and the SANDWICHES ARE DELICIOUS! 
A large is $9 add extra meat $3.75 and additional avocado $1.20.... Comes out to be a pretty expensive sandwich but try it and you'd be a loyal customer for life.

Tip: only one type of bread here and it's the perfect one. Soft french toasted =)

Also tip the guys they really appreciate it!
author: Liz N.

description: Taraval St institution.  Excellent subs, similar to the subs I grew up on at Marina Submarine.  Enough variety to keep things interesting!  The sauce is similar to Italian dressing I think and it works really well on the sandwiches.  I dunno where they get their bread but it is also perfect for their sandwiches.  And fantastic selection of snacks, beers, drinks to accompany your food.  Love this place.
author: David P.

description:
Sandwiches taste great - I dont care what anyone says I will always go back.

Sunset's Best Sandwiches!
author: Nicholas V.

description:
My favorite place to get sandwiches in the sunset! The owner is a very nice older man and I love supporting family owned small businesses 

My go-to sandwich is: roasted turkey, lettuce, tomato, pickles, and their special sauce on a toasted roll :p mhmmmmm
author: Chung L.

description: Best sandwich I have ever had! The bread is crunchy the sauce is good and everything balances each other well. Highly recommend!
author: N K.

description: The sandwiches are so yummy. It is no fuss, a straight up good sandwich. Been trying to come get one for 3 weeks, but because I live farther now, I really have to wait until I am in the area to grab one. The turkey sandwich with everything is my favorite. :3
author: Victoria C.

description: Best sandwiches I've ever had. The secret sauce is bomb AF, and so is the bread. And the guys working the counter and making the sandwiches are hilarious.
author: Laura A.

description: Why does Gene's subs taste so good?? Unfortunately he'd have to "dispose" of me if he was to tell me, so I'll keep quiet and eat up the goodness. Simply the best subs I've had anywhere in the world.
author: Roger F.

description: This is my favorite sandwich spot in all of SF. The bread and sauce combo is yum yum yum. Delicioso mama Mia!!
author: Max F.

description: Toasty goodness, plain and simple. CRUNCHY shredded lettuce and melted cheese, works for laundry days :)
author: Dianne A.

description: Cheap and delicious sandwiches. If you are in the sunset, it's worth a stop on your way to the beach! Try the tuna and bbq chicken. Best on the menu!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Among other foods, sandwiches always remain a heated debate between my friends and I. But no matter what, I consistently find myself keeping Gene's in my Top 5. An institution of some sort in the Sunset, Gene's Liquor stands unassuming on the corner. It may seem like a regular liquor stop, but the sandwiches here are great at its core. Simple, no frills, made from the same 2-level oven for years, these sandwiches keep the neighborhood and the surrounding schools satisfied.

My personal favorites are the atomic sub and pastrami sandwich, which I order 90% of the time. These two and most of the sandwiches on the menu come on toasted bread with the inclusion of mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomato, cheese, and choice of pickles, peppers and secret sauce. This addicting and always dripping sauce is along the lines of an Italian dressing with a little kick. That straightforward combination make for a classic sandwich, no matter what meat is included. Of course, it is still is a liquor store, so it won't be hard to find your preference of chips and drink. Explore the short menu, but you will not be disappointed with the pastrami. Ask the multitude of hungry, after-school, high school kids that frolic and back up the line out the street to the Muni stop. They will tell you, especially since the average $8-9 per sandwich is a large chunk of their allowance.

The last thing I have to include is Hamik, the store owner and "head sandwich maker". He may give you that glazed look and seems like a disinterested liquor store attendant. But stop and have a conversation with him. HE makes Gene's what it is, and what makes this sandwich special. Once you become a regular, he'll remember your order, how many napkins you need, and even the Arizona tea flavor you always get. Maybe he'll make fun of your hat or ask why you're dressed so nicely. Almost 15 years later, Hamik still does the same for me. Sadly, shops like these do not exist anymore, making Gene's a must-stop in the Sunset.
author: Carlo D.

description:
I've lived in the area for a year now and I've heard about these amazing sandwiches over and over again. Today, I didn't feel like cooking dinner so I decided to walk on over and FINALLY give these sandwiches a try. 

When I walked in, there was a tiny line so I wandered around. BUNCHES of drink options, lots of places for chips, but only a small selection. Looked like maybe they were about to restock within the next couple of days.

Found a Beverage and some chips, grabbed dessert (candy bar) while I was at it then stepped up the the counter. Ordered the small Salami. It was made really fast and professionally. 

Gene, or whom I assume is Gene, was really polite and friendly. 

My sandwich ROCKED! Tones of meat and cheese, good amount of mustard and secret sauce. It was perfection. WAY better then the French Bakery's Salami Sandwich I had up the street last month.

I will totally be back for another sandwich. 

$10 minimum on cards, if it is less then $10 you are charged $0.50 to use a Debt or Credit  Card.
author: Meghan L.

description: Amazing local sandwiches, for a good price! A Pastrami sandwich from this place and a dr. pepper and your set right for any meal!
author: Adam L.

description: Came here for lottery tickets but picked up a sandwich. Didn't get to it right after it was toasted but it was still good. Need to try it fresh after it comes our from the oven.
author: Alicia A.

description:
Gene's Liquors offers large deli sammies (6), lots of liquors, snacks, convenience food items.

lots of mainstream beers, microbrews, german singles too. pricing average or slightly higher.

buys: mexican ice cream (coffee flavor 1.25)
-seems all stores in s.f. carry it.

drips:
-friendly acknowledgement, service.
-sammie look huge....
author: Victor G.

description: I dont care what anyone says, this is the best Sandwich in the city.
author: Arshia M.

description: Love the sandwiches here.  Used to be in and out, but now there's a line.  Still worth it.  Best sandwiches in the neighborhood for sure even with the new places opening up nearby.
author: Warren B.

description: I've been living near here for almost 3 years now and the sandwiches are still amazeballs. Perfectly toasted, carefully crafted and fresh ingredients. I always get roast beef, hold the mayo and tomatoes, add avocado. Grab your favorite bag of chips and a drink, and you're good to go. It's perfect for those rare but beautiful warm SF beach bum days or when you're just not in the mood for cooking or ordering pizza. Thanks Hamik!
author: Daisy D.

description:
You think that any place that claims "best whatever" is hyperbole, but here, it is one of the best subs in SF.  Even though the prices have gone up over the past few years, you can still walk out with a large Atomic (the most expensive sub) with a drink for the same price as a combo at Subway, but more filling.  If you order a large, bring your appetite because it is packed.  I have failed to eat a single sub that didn't squeeze out meat and sauce, it is that full.  They're so consistent with the subs too, they're exactly the same every time.  And the bread is always perfectly fresh and toasted.

Support your local businesses!
author: Dylan T.

description:
My brother in law was getting some work done at the house and we needed to grab a bite of grub to get through the day. There's a popular deli at the corner so we walked over to check it out. There was a big sign out front calling their sandwich the best in town, so you know I had to give it a try.

I ordered the large atomic sub for $8.35 with some chips and the whole thing came out to about $11. Not the cheapest sub in town to be sure. However, they did load it up with three kinds of meat and all the fixin's and it was a pretty darn good sandwich. I don't know if I'd call it the best though.

It's a really convenient place to grab a quite lunch before hopping on the train, but all items are significantly marked up. Sandwich quality was excellent and the ingredients were very fresh. I'd drop by again in a bind but it wouldn't be an everyday thing. Service was outstanding though and the boss was extremely helpful and happy!

Food: 7/10

Service: 9/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description: 2 years ago this place was THEE place for hot sandwiches. When Hamik was making the sandwiches, he would give a fair to generous amount of meat. I went there yesterday and had a really bad sandwich. For $9.00 I got a large pastrami sandwich with 2 very thin pieces of meat. Really disappointing and I will take my business back to west portal's submarine center where they still do it right.
author: Chris M.

description:
I used to come here all the time for sandwiches when I was in high school. At one point, the man behind the deli memorized my order! All I had to do was walk in there, and he'll start making my sandwich! I usually get a turkey sandwich with swiss cheese and everything and occasionally avocados if I'm up for it. A can of Arizona sweet tea is also my personal favorite companion to my sandwich. The sandwich is always packed with flavor thanks to the secret sauce and very filling and satisfying. Sometimes I can't finish the sandwich and I cry a little on the inside because it would go to waste.

Unfortunately, going out of state for college have deprived me of the great sandwiches that this place has to offer. But it only makes these sandwiches that much more delicious every time I get one when I'm back in the city!
author: Julianne Z.

description:
I love this place because:

1. The subs are really yummy! I wish yelp had sound so I could record that amazing noise when you bite into it and you hear that crisp from the oven toasted goodness...

2. The owner is always so nice and friendly which is amazing considering that it appears he never takes a day off.

3. It is a very welcome departure of so many overpriced, pretentious places in this city.
author: Naomi W.

description: Usually, me and my brother buy sandwiches from Ike's. However, we decided to give Gene's sandwiches a chance and honestly, we might love it more than Ike's. Although there are only two people working, the line goes by quit fast and there's plenty of snacks to purchase as you wait for your sandwich. I love the vibe in there and the owner is super sweet. People usually call in to place their orders ahead of time. These are quite pricier than other sandwiches but the sandwiches are quite massive. We recommend the atomic sub! Warning: You might need all the napkins they offer! :) Messy but delish!
author: Katherine L.

description:
Sandwiches from a liquor store?  Are you sure about this?  

I ordered the large atomic sub with no onions.  The bread was toasted which gave it a crunch on the outside but still soft in the inside.  It's the perfect size and good amount of meat and veggies.  Make sure you're sitting down while eating because for people like me, it might get messy.

Don't judge a book by it's cover!
author: Linda N.

description:
SANDWICHES! Enough said. I'm super lazy and try to avoid walking as much as possible but I do not mind walking my lazy self over to Gene's and that says a lot! I get too excited about my sandwich and before I know it, I'm already back home ready to devour my food. 
I love how the bread is always perfectly crispy. The sandwiches are consistent and they never skimp on the fillings. You have an option of choosing between a regular and large size. You can also add extras such as jalapeños and avocado. 
You might want to call in and put an order in advance if you want to avoid waiting because there are waits sometimes. 
But if you order on the spot, Gene is usually working alone so service can be slow but be patient because it will all be worth it!
author: Joanne L.

description:
The sandwiches are really good here.  I'm kind of impartial to the large atomic.  Just call in before you get there if you want to skip waiting around.  

The prices have gone up by a good deal but the quality didnt go down like at a lot of other places, so its still a good spot.
author: Andrew L.

description: Love the sandwiches here especially the hot pastrami with everything including the secret sauce. I love the place and everyone who works here is super nice. I also like,that the owner gets to know you after awhile so he'll sometime know your order if you order same sammi. Did I mention prices are very reasonable. Try it you'll like it.
author: David M.

description:
Love this place for sandwiches....the ONLY place I get sandwiches.

The owner is a sweet guy and provides great customer service =)

Def a place to grab a quick delicious sandwich and go to ocean beach to eat it! My roommate and I would do this!
author: Shanitte N.

description: 1st time. Goooooooood stuff. Got the atomic bomb sandwich.  A great sandwich in a liquor store?  Awesome
author: w t.

description:
I just had a extremely tasty sandwich.

I just ate it a few moments ago, and I could not wait to write about how great the sandwich was. It happened like that when I went to Grubbin' Sandwich on the same street about 10 blocks up.
Matter of fact that I was heading the grubbing' today but when I was driving, the sign for Gene's saying "Best Sandwich in town!" got a corner of my eyes. And I found out that there is no parking meters!!!

9.5 inches long a large size oven toasted combo sandwich (turkey, pastrami and corned beef) calls Gene's Atomic Sub w/ everything, was A REAL A-BUMB! 
$8.85 include tax.
The sandwich roll was crunchy and a bit chewy, that was nice, and the 3 sliced meat were great with the roll when I bite into it. I really like the special sauce w/ the fresh chopped lettuce and tomato.

This out of nowhere Outer Sunset Gene's Liquor is out on Taraval Street. 
This area, Dirty Harry might say VFB, very few blacks. 
The place looks like an ugly old liquor grocery store that I don't think I'd pay attention but the sign. 

Sorry Grubbin' I'll be there later, but Hello to Gene!!!
I think Gene's sandwich is a buck cheeper than Grubbin'.
I like them both though.

Made my date today. Thank you Gene so much!
I will be back for more.
author: Nobu K.

description:
When I walked in, I spoke with the owner, who was extremely personable and friendly. Ordered the Atomic, along with some basic sundries (hey, it is a liquor store, right?). Very quick turnaround, went back to work and unwrapped the sub.

H-O-L-Y S-H-I-T. This is what a sandwich is all about. The bread with it's toasted to perfection, crunchy and flaky deliciousness. Ingredients that are in the right proportions - not an abundance of lettuce and a lack of meat , but everything just right. A dressing that ties it all together. This was sandwich perfection.

I'm glad I live so close, because now I know the go to sandwich shop in the Outer Sunset. This place is top notch!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
If you like sub center at West Portal, you will love the sandwiches at Gene's! 

Sandwiches are amazing! Ask for extra of their "secret sauce."

Pros: parking is easy and the wait is usually better. You can also buy alcohol and other items that can be found at any convenient store. 

Cons: for those that eat meat, they give you less meat (I don't have to worry about that since I always get a veggie). Also, the owner  looks like he's going to kill himself (I wish he would hire more help).
author: Anastasia N.

description: Great little hidden gem! Sandwiches are delicious! Nice selection of candy, chips, and beverages...both alcoholic, and non. Great customer service. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Halina C.

description:
Legend has it that Sub Center copied Gene's...that's according to Gene.

Whatever.  It doesn't matter who started it because Gene's Liquor is solid on their atomic subs.  I'm so jealous of San Franciscans who have sandwich shops like this and don't even know about it because they don't have places of this caliber in Phoenix/Scottsdale.  No complaints.  Friendly people.  FIVE STARS
author: Sam K.

description:
This place is directly across the street from 7-Eleven and right in front of a bus stop. Their prices are higher than 7's, but they have more kinds of certain stuff, such as hard liquor. 

Their sandwiches and being right in front of a bus stop keeps this place in business. Their sandwiches are pretty good and sometimes it is better to spend a little more than risk missing your ride.
author: M C.

description:
Our pal, Hamik, is without a doubt the heart of the 32nd block of Taraval. His sandwiches have been there for us when nothing else could fill that void. You know--just...there for you. Bad break-up? Gene's! Crappy day at school? Gene's! Just graduated college? GENE'S CATERS! (JK, Hamik, lol!) 

Besides all of this, he has the memory of an elephant and always remembers the orders of my roommates and I. The best combo is a drink, a bag of chips, and a good ol' sub. 

I recommend grabbing a Gene's sandwich without reservation! YUM!!!!!
author: Alina L.

description: The guy who works here is great. He's always pleasant to talk to, he gives you dead-on estimates on how long it will take him to get your sandwiches ready, and he makes pretty awesome sandwiches, too!
author: Karina R.

description:
I cannot believe Gene's wasn't in my life when I went to school just a couple blocks away from this corner market! I've had sandwiches from convenience stores that doesn't differ much from Genes appearance-wise. That being said, the sandwiches totally sets this place apart from the others! If it's your first time here, you must try their specialty atomic sub - perfect for meat lovers since it includes pastrami, corned beef, and turkey. Every sandwich comes with their specialty sauce but don't hesitate to ask for more if you like your sandwiches on the wetter side, or if you're just craving an extra kick of flavor. My only suggestion to you is to tell them to go lighter on their onions unless you don't mind that full-on raw onion flavor in sandwiches. Order the regular size if you have a moderate appetite, but go for the large if you're especially hungry or if you're sharing. 

Once you try their atomic, I would also recommend trying their other sandwiches. I personally think their pastrami sandwiches alone are super satisfying, especially if you add avocado. All their sammies are about $6-7 which is reasonable for a good lunch. 

Lunch times can get really busy. I usually call in and place an order so I can just pick it up and avoid long lines. However, sometimes (peak lunch hours), it gets so busy that they tell you to either call back or to place your order in-person. It'll be worth your wait though, so don't be scared of the extra 15 minutes you'll spend in here.
author: Regina C.

description:
I love this place!! 

Whenever I need a quick lunch close by work, I stop by Gene's. I love that they take orders over the phone and sandwiches are normally ready within 10-15 minutes. BUT, keep in mind that they get VERY busy when there's a sports game going on.

I love the service here; everyone is always friendly, welcoming, and funny. They are very enthusiastic, personable, and kind of tired looking. (Small private shops, it happens) I really didn't expect that from a liquor store, it's a great plus.

The sandwiches here are absolutely to die for. I love the salami sandwich with pepperjack cheese and avocado. It's my favorite combo!! The bread is always perfectly toasted and their secret sauce complements the sandwich so well. Definitely glad they give napkins cause it can get a bit messy.  

The regular sized sandwiches are a decent portion if you're not trying to food coma at work. If you're looking for sandwiches piled with a ton of meat, I don't think this is the place to go to. But even with that being said, I still think they give a fair amount for what you're paying. 

If you're ever in the area or trying to have a picnic at the beach or something, stop by and try their sandwiches, you won't regret it. Unless you don't like sandwiches, then you should just opt for something else. :P
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Passed by this place a hundred times and bought vodka from this place a hundred times, but never ordered a SANGWHICH (what my grandma calls them). 

Was too lazy to make it to Freddy's, so I decided to try it out, I mean check out all the sweet reviews! 

I ordered the Veggie and yea it was good, but It was not making love on a sunday afternoon good, it was just regular good, A-ok good.  I mean for a nondescript deli on Taraval, yea the tosty bastard was yummy, but I do not really get all the 4 and 5 star reviews?  

Again, still good and by far the best sang I have had out of a liquor store, but I'd say next time it is worth it to make it to Freddy's.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Maybe I'm not a believer in hot sandwiches. 

I really feel like Guerra's is one of the best sandwiches in the area. 

Gene's liquor sandwich was good, but not fantastic. The line was long and I had really high hopes, but usually that is a bad sign for me. The hype didn't match the sandwich IMO. 

I can see the appeal, but the sandwich isn't that massive and is kind of expensive. 

Would consider going back, but there are so many sandwich places to cross off my list still. 

I will add, I really do like that this is a friendly neighborhood shop with a lot of locals visiting and ordering. Thank you Gene's for the neighborhood feel.
author: Alison N.

description:
Lights flickering & a liquor store that kind of smells like batteries...that's Gene's for you.

I didn't want a Safeway sammich so I drove over here for an Atomic Sub. What's in it? Turkey, Pastrami, & Corned Beef (my fav)...Gene's special sauce, onions, mayo, mustard, lettuce, cheese, pickles...last time, I was just guessing, but this time I actually saw the menu. For $8.35, you get a large ATOMIC SAMMICH, big enough for 2. I've never actually ate one alone, I've always shared it.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Local corner store with a side sandwich bar inside. How good could it be? Surprisingly, it was pretty decent. 

I was a bit skeptical at first. Drove past it for years and I never went in. Finally, we decided to try it. We went on Friday night, and there was no line. I think it is typically pretty quiet there. Simple menu with regular and large size options customers can choose from. We tried the Gene's Atomic Sub with turkey, pastrami, and corned beef. The sandwich comes with mustard, mayo, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cheese, and their secret sauce. 

I was questioning their bread choice, but I was most surprised, their bread works for their sandwich content. They toast the bread and it totally holds up all the meat and sauces. The secret sauce is mild flavored, but worth trying if you are in the neighborhood and craving a sandwich. This is a surprising find and pretty good for being a side bar inside a local corner store.
author: Janice T.

description: Gene's is the best! Awesome sandwiches, reasonable prices, and great location. Oh, and the owner, Hamik is very friendly. He's great at recognizing the regular customers and even remembers what sandwiches you like to order.
author: Michael M.

description: Best sandwich place in the neighborhood! The secret sauce is AMAZING! I always ask for extra. Awesome customer service. The owner is always there making the sandwiches and he always tells me he is about the quality. Since i'm a regular he knows my order! Even when I was off to college he still remembered my order.
author: Jade T.

description:
I've been to Gene's to pick up a six pack or a snack on the way to a friend's home nearby but didn't have a chance to get a sandwich until tonight. Clearly I'd been missing out.

I ordered an italian combo and it was great. I ordered it with everything (minus tomatoes) and it was exactly what I wanted and the price was a super bargain in these artisan curated overdone times. I can't stress enough how good this was. 

They also have a good selection of beers and such, and they even have Strongbow in .5 liter cans. Everyone needs to know how great this place is!
author: Greg D.

description: Sandwiches are overrated. The bread is ok but very little meat and did not taste the "secret" sauce
author: Gir G.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE gene's. I was first taken here my freshman year of college by two friends from San Francisco, and have fallen in love ever since.

The sandwiches are delicious. I never have liked toasted subs in my life, but something about Gene's is delicious and perfect. 
I always order the turkey with everything on it.. that includes cheese! Unlike most places that charge for cheese. 

The outside would turn you off from buying a sandwich, but do NOT let that turn you away from this amazing place. 

The man who works behind the counter is such a friendly nice personable guy; he makes you want to come back everyday just to talk to him!

Love this place and I highly recommend it.
author: Annie C.

description:
I have been going to this store since before he started making sandwiches.  The owner is not Gene, his name is Hamik.  Every time I walk in, he greets me by name.  I just ask for the usual, which he has remembered without fail for years.  The only question is if I want the regular size or the big one...  
Since this is a popular place around mealtimes, I would recommend calling in your order 5-10m before you get there.  When they say, 'do you want everything?' they mean - cheese mayo mustard lettuce tomato onions and secret sauce.  I am a 'no mustard no onions' type of guy.  You can always add avocado, peppers, or jalapeno as well.
In my opinion, this is the best sandwich spot in the sunset.  If you like a good sandwich, check out Gene's Liquor.  
My favorite is grabbing one to go and taking it to the Giants game to eat in the stands
author: Mike Y.

description: Kyle N. here, genes is amazing amazing! Super friendly and SUPER FAT KID!  Order any sandwich large w/ everything BAH!!!
author: Laura P.

description: Best sandwiches in the Sunset (and one of the best in the city), better than Guerra's, little hidden treasure.
author: Adriana L.

description: Yummy Sandwiches! The Italiano sandwich is delicious. Yes, please everything on it with jalapenos. Ooo, that garlic sauce and fresh meats & toppings. Oh, that warm toasted lightly crunch bread! I'm salivating right now and want more. Wish there's a Gene's Liquor or Hamik's Sandwich Shop in Oakland. Next one to try will be the Atomic. Can't wait to be back. The old guy behind the register may look grumpy but he's a very nice man.
author: Amy H.

description:
Pretty standard submarine sandwich. 

I've been passing by here for the last 10 years and never walked in. The other day, I thought why not? So I did. I got the large atomic sub like many have suggested. It was good, but pretty standard. There were three types of meat in the sandwich, but I only tasted the overwhelming pastrami meat versus the others (turkey and roast beef). As usual, I always get "everything" on it and it was pretty standard as well. I would come back if I was craving an all around standard sandwich. This place was pretty good. The large could easily feed two people. It took me three separate occasions just to finish the whole thing!

At 8 bucks and some change it was worth it. It fed me 3 times that day! Well worth it.
author: Amy C.

description: what a great find! I always order the hot pastrami with lettuce, tomato, cheese, light mayo, and their secret sauce. it's a must!
author: Ann T.

description:
Maybe the five star is a bit excessive (because I rarely employ it) but if so, barely. It's definitely a five star place.  I always get the Italiano. The sandwiches are great. A lot of people wouldn't expect a liquor store to have great sandwiches but these guys have perfected their art. 

Also it's got a good beer selection and the guys behind the counter are the best. It's well worth it to take this place over 711.
author: Brendan B.

description: This place is your one-stop-shop! Beer, wine, liquor, chips, sandwiches, and tic tacs! The sandwiches are really good! The secret's in the secret sauce which is probably Italian dressing, so it's not such a secret, but it's really good. If you're in the neighborhood and feel like a tasty affordable lunch, try it out.
author: Janu A.

description:
I've been coming here for sandwiches for almost 8 years. Yeah it's a corner store, but the sandwiches here are delicious! Reasonable priced too. You can pick up a bag of chips and a drink while you're waiting. Yum!

I usually get a turkey or a roast beef with mayo, mustard, lettuce, and tomatoes toasted. 

You can call in.
author: Jess W.

description:
Two words: Yummy sandwiches (:

Conveniently located at a MUNI stop, this little corner store carries slightly overpriced chips and candies and make tasty sandwiches!

I really enjoy the Atomic sandwich; the 3 types of meats are a perfect combination. The bread is very toasty AND the cheese is melted! I personally think the veggie portion and meat portion is okay, not too skimpy, but definitely not meat heavy. But the secret sauce is probably the star of the sandwich, because it's a bit tangy and that adds to the yum factor! 

The sandwiches here is what made me give them 4 stars. Sandwiches are at a decent price, about 7 bucks for about 6 inches. The rest of the store is quite dingy. So, be warned that they don't take card unless you have a $10 minimum charge, so bring cash unless you plan to buy more than just a sandwich or use their personal ATM machine.  Don't expect a dining area, it is a corner store!
author: Raven L.

description:
After 10 years of coming here, they are still the best damn sub sandwich I've ever had. They are consistently good-the bread is always crunchy, ingredients are always fresh, and I still don't know whats in that secret special sauce. 

The people who work here are so friendly, always greeting with a smile and a good attitude. 

This place is definitely a secret treasure of SF.
author: Denise W.

description:
Everything is overpriced except their sandwiches!!

One time I paid $36 for a bottle of Jameson, yeah I know bad idea but we needed drank and since this place is next door to my house, I said why not!? While you're there picking up an overprice bottle of booze, you might as well pick up a delicious sandwich! Those things are amazing! Make sure you get extra special sauce because that's what makes the sandwich. Gene is nice enough but he won't make you a sandwich if it's past 10 P.M so make sure you get there before that. Frankly, I think Gene needs to take some time off because I see him there every damn day! Like come on bro, take a vacay or something haha. 

They have anything you need or at least anything you can't find at the 7-11 across the street. The place is located in front of the L stop so that's very convenient. 

It's a liquor store that offers awesome sandwiches so what do you expect?
author: Javier G.

description:
The staff are amazing the sandwiches are INCREDIBLE .. can be busy because theres a queue for sandwiches (around lunch time
usually) but worth the wait as they are fab, with their "secret sauce" ...and everyone is so friendly love this place !
author: Paula M.

description: Gene the guy who makes your sandwich is a very nice guy.  Ive been going here for a very long time and I got to say that in the last few months the quality of the sandwiches really went down :(  hope the quality goes back to what it was otherwise im going to look for another spot in the area soon.
author: Diana s.

description:
Gene's is the shit.  Any haters can suck it.  If you feel like it's not all that awesome, then I suggest you stop coming, go back to your shitty hometown, and eat at a chain because you are clogging up the sunset. 

I love Gene's!! Been going since high school and I am never disappointed.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Hidden in what would normally be your average liquor store lies one of San Francisco's best deli sandwich shops. Mysterious like the dark side of the moon, this sandwich making ninja "Gene" holds the secret to a perfect sub.

Now I may not be a hoagie connoisseur of sorts, but I've had my fair share of awesome sandwiches. This place ranks up there.

Conveniently located near the bus stop, what better way to wait for Muni than with a good salami sandwich? For best results, combine the sandwich with Slim Jim, a bag of Funyuns, and a Snapple. You're welcome.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Really good sandwhices!!! The special sauce they put in it is awesome.

Family owned and the owner is really nice!
author: Lauren N.

description:
Hooch and sandwich... yeah!!!!

Gene's Liquor looks like your usual seedy corner liquor store, but in the Sunset, you can get a prettty tasty sub sandwich with your smokes and mini tequila bottle.

I must comment on how neat the guy made my sandwich.  Even smears of mustard and mayo and even the way he folded each slice of turkey was so pleasant to watch.  It was like he was doing laundry.  He didn't allow too much over hang and even the lettuce was kept within the borders of the bread.  I really hate it when ingredients are piled on so high that it squirts out after first bite.

He toasted it just right so it's crunchy and hot and for the final touch, a squirt of "secret sauce".  It's a good solid sub, but the secret sauce wasn't very pronounced.  It looked like a cousin of Italian dressing, but I didn't taste any of that tang and herbs.  

The bread was good, but I hate to compare, it isn't SubCenter bread.  The crackling crispiness, where the crumbs break off and dissolve into your tongue at the same time isn't there.  I bet the fog has a small effect on it... soaking in all that humdity.  But still, it's a good 2nd place and nice alternative when I don't want to circle for parking and want to avoid a thick ass line.
author: Chris T.

description:
Mehhhhhh!!

I've heard so much about this place and its sandwiches, and although yes -- they are good, they are not sandwiches sent down from Heaven. I feel like the friends that I know that constantly talk about how great this place is overrate it heavily..

On the two or three times I've been here, I've gotten the pastrami sandwich on sourdough and it's been solid each and every time. The prices are fair, the people behind the counter are nice, and yes -- the sandwiches are good. But there's definitely other places in the Sunset and nearby areas that serve better custom made sandwiches.

I will tip my cap, however, to the fact that Gene's has been able to make a strong reputation off its' sandwiches despite only being a small corner store.
author: Sean B.

description: The sandwiches here are really really good. They can toast em and they have lot of options. Also, you can get beer and wine. Win win.
author: Petey F.

description:
Reluctant to review because of how amazing this place is, I almost don't want to share.

The sandwiches are done RIGHT, super affordable, they have a great selection of drinks--just magical. (Sandwich + drink for $6.50!)

Great turkey sandwich. Be sure to order with everything on it!

In summation, don't eat here.
author: Sara D.

description:
a decent alternative to ike's sandwiches due to lack of wait time 

I got the large atomic sub sandwich with avacado (+$1.20 for about 1/2 an avacado), which was about a footlong with turkey, pastrami, and corned beef. The sandwich also included cheese, lettuce, tomato, mayo, mustard, and onions. You also have the option of toasting your sandwich. My total came out to $9.55 and wait time was about 5 mins around 1pm on a sunday. 

The sandwich itself was almost as dirty as ikes sandwiches but gene's version of their dirty sauce was a little more watery and not as flavorful compared to ike's. Their meats wasnt too special but I wish they could have given more. The toasted sub bread ended up being kinda hard and too crunchy for my taste. 

Since its a liquor store also, you can also purchase a wide selection of alcohol and or other snacks and chips to accompany your sandwich. Since I live less than 5 mins away from this place and since the L passes by this place also, I think the location is better than ike's. Not to mention the decrease in wait time by 30x compared to ike's. 

I would recommend this place as an alternative to people wanting a nice dirty sandwich who doesn't want to wait hrs to get one.
author: Robert Y.

description: A great place to grab a quick hot lunch and snacks. Also a really nice owner.
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
Sandwiches, Subs, I toss them all in the same category.  Gene's Liquor is a small, quiet corner store in the heart of Sunset, on Taraval and 32nd avenue right across from the 7-11. I must say that the deli counter isn't very attractive to someone who's coming in looking for lunch and the selection isn't tremendously vast neither.  I will say that if you're in the area and looking for a bite that's not taquitos or big bite hot dogs, Gene's subs are definitely a consideration.

Gene's Atomic sub comes with turkey, pastrami and corned beef (i think salami too? i could be wrong), along with cheese, your normal everyday condiments and their specialty sauce.  I usually request no mayonnaise but toss in pickles and jalapenos instead.  Lastly, they will toasted it.  You can request for it to be not toasted but why not? Overall, the guys working (owner) are super nice so if you have special requests, they're not gonna give you a hard time about it.

The sub costs ranges from $6 to $9 for a reasonable size sandwich.  This tends to be a busy spot especially during the school year and after school.  And since this is a liquor store, you can buy your chips, drinks, etc along with your sandwich.
author: Keith N.

description:
Gene's was once my FAV go-to deli sando spot.  In a very deceiving corner store, was one of my oh so yummy beloved classic sandwich...the ultimate hot pastrami sandwich....

BUT oh how the years have changed... 

This past weekend I called in my order for 4 large hot pastramis.. Got there in 15 mins with them all ready packed in a bag.. cool...

As I broke out the sandwiches on a nice sunny Sunday..still hunger from the night before... ready to devour a fat juicy Gene's sando.... Instead I got what appeared to be a wet salad between two pieces of bread.............. WTF

OK OK there was like 2 slices of meat I think... but seriously?!?! for $7.48 I expect a little more then that!!!  Ok..maybe it was just MY sando... but nope.. all 4 had skimp helpings of pastrami... 

Later my friend mentioned it was because I called it in, and wasn't STANDING there to look on the making of my sandwich.. shady....

Broken down looking liquor store, with suspect looking veggies and skimp meat portions.....charging gourmet sandwich prices...... OVER IT.
author: Deanna T.

description:
For all your quick needs. Condoms, Booze, Blunt Wraps, they got it!

But what really stands out is that Gene's is the Sunset liquor store that offers a mean sandwich. I always stop by to pick up a hot pastrami sandwich. The bread is toasted in the oven, and the meats are hand cut by Gene himself. Try one with everything, I'll assure you that you'll be quite surprised at how good these sandwiches are. Most people would like to compare them to Submarine Center on West portal. I'd agree myself. The only thing that sends me to Gene's is the good price and quality service. Remember, ask nicely, and you will receive nice things.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I love sandwiches.

Like many other liquor stores, they make fresh sandwiches. Their specialty, the atomic sub, is especially good. It consists of three types of meat: salami, pastrami, and something else. You get your choice of cheese and condiments. You also get the choice to have your baguette toasted or not. (I recommend that you do.) Don't forget to ask them for more of their specialty sauce on your sandwich! All in all, the sandwiches here are yummy. Typically, it's a little under $6 for a small sub and a little more than $8 for a large sub.
author: Annie S.

description: Ike's is the best place for sandwiches, in my honest opinion, but Gene's is a decent substitute if you're too lazy to drive over to the Castro. The first time I had a sandwich from Gene's was a year or two ago with my cousin and we were left unimpressed. I haven't gone back until recently, and that's only because I work two blocks away, so it's convenient for me and my coworkers to walk over and grab lunch when we don't have time. My coworker claims that they make the best pastrami sandwich, so definitely try that! Overall, not bad, and I'm always down to support local businesses!
author: Audrey T.

description:
I go to Genes all the time. Gene and the rest of the staff are all extremely friendly, and the sandwiches are absolutely delicious. I used to go to the the 7-11 across the street, but after going to Genes have chosen to support his business instead. 
There is a good selection of beer/wine/liquor at decent prices, a wide variety of deli options for specialty sandwiches, and is fully stocked with the typical items found in convenience stores. 
I definitely suggest going here. Genes is a great local establishment in the Sunset, and has a Muni stop for the L-Taraval train right outside the door! 
My only complaint is that this place is not open as late as some liquor/convenience stores...but thats totally reasonable since it is not a huge chain with tons of employees. You can look forward to seeing familiar and friendly faces at Gene's.
author: Gina M.

description: They provide the best sandwiches in the sunset! Even when they have a line, they are friendly and maintain a sense of humor. They make the best sandwiches in the area and its always worth the wait!!
author: cory a.

description: Gene's a great guy, and the sandwiches are fantastic. Nothing super fancy, but great deli cuts, great bread, great service.
author: Caleb O.

description: First off, let me say I am on a hunt to find the best sandwich place in SF that is not too far from where I live. This place REALLY hits the spot! I'm starting to learn that sometimes the sketchier the outside, the better the sandwich! I would never before assume that a liquor store would make good sandwiches but this place does a GREAT job. It's not too pricey...the portions are large...and you can go to the same place to get your liquor as your dinner! Only reason I did not give it 5 stars is they could put a little more meat on the sandwich and take it easy on the dressing. Mayo, mustard, and secret sauce is a bit much when the focus should be on the meat.
author: Kelsey Q.

description:
Everytime I see Gene's liquors, it makes me want to buy a 22 because then I can think to myself, "I didn't buy this Fat Tire from Safeway. I am subverting capitalism." Complete nonsense, but it makes me feel better inside. I would like to make it my personal cause to get young folks to buy liquor from small businesses. If you're going to buy the devil's juice, why not make it slight the man just a little? Gene's liquor is exactly the type of small busines I tell myself to support.

Sandwich update: I tried the subs at Gene's. They are huge, wet, and toasted (like i like my men), but seriously folks, this was a very decent sandwich. The service is abrupt, but neighborly. (They remembered who I was). If you're in the hood, check out Gene's!
author: Netty L.

description:
The place is a total dive; I mean even by liquor store standards, this place looks like the pits. But the sandwiches rock, and by sandwiches I mean the ATOMIC. Don't even think about getting anything else, just stick with the atomic coz it's got all the goodness in there. Great sauce and toasted perfectly in their italian mini-oven. 

The only thing that pisses me off is that every time I go, the prices seem to go up, and the sandwich seems to be shrinking in size. Oh well.

PS. A little tip for you - call ahead with your order.
author: Dom L.

description:
Gene's is the spot if you need a sandwich or a couple swishers for a discount price. Wait, let me clarify... swishers are at a discount price and the sandwiches are about average price.

And damn, dude still knows me after not going in there for like 5 years. Maybe he's just faking, and if he is, he's got me fooled. 

Shot out to Hamik!!!
author: Mike B.

description:
Once upon a time quite a few years ago, I lived less then two blocks from Genes, I would go there for sandwiches and vitamin waters almost every other day.. 
Gene can make a sandwich like nobody's business. The Atomic sub btw, kicks ass! I also suggest the salami and cheese if you aren't into Atomic spicy. At any rate, if you are on Taravel @ 32nd hit up Genes liquor store and definitely try a sub he's been making sandwiches for decades and they are superb.
author: Tawnya C.

description:
Yes, it is weird that a liquor store in the outer avenues makes a freaking delicious sandwich but so be it. I can't count the number of times I have gotten a veggie sub sandwich from this place and it has consistently been good. Nice toasty bread, generous with the avocado, yum! It is the perfect sandwich.

I've gotten other people hooked on these sandwiches too. So far I've only eaten the veggie but I have heard the meat ones are good too.

Writing this review and seeing the pictures is making me hungry for a veggie sub!
author: Audrey H.

description:
Gene tightly converted a corner of his behind the counter space into a sandwich shop. His shop is old, small, and the smells are questionable but his deli ingredients are AFAP(as fresh as possible). The pastrami and corned beef are great quality. The turkey is so so. Mix them altogether and you got an Atomic Sub.

The Atomic Sub is his specialty. The combo of meats with melted cheese and special sauce is a hearty filling for a warm toasted sub. My regular Atomic Sub, water, and kettle chips cost 8 bucks. 

All Sandwiches are toasted and hot with special sauce. Gene says "Ask me for a cold sub and I'll send you across the street to 7-Eleven." 

The special sauce is a runny vinegar style that helps soften the crunch of the toasted bread.

No hurries here or tables for that matter and a line can be expected but if you happen to be on Taraval and 32nd with a hunger for something to go, give Gene's a shot.
author: R J.

description: If you're in the area, pop into this liquor store for a sandwich! Menu can be intimidating at first, but you pretty much choose the size of your sandwich, your meat and cheese and say what you don't want on your sub. Pastrami was delicious and my husband's atomic sub was great too. Love that they toast the sandwiches too. The bread is a bit lacking in chewiness, but you can't beat the neighborhood feel and the love that goes into their toasty subs!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Best sandwich in the city? No, I wouldn't say that but it is pretty high up there taste-wise.

The bread is some of the best I have ever had. Untoasted, it is soft and not too chewy. Toasted, it is flaky and warm but not too hard where it scratches the roof of your mouth.

I had the Atomic Sub and it was pretty damn delicious. Their special sauce is basically just Italian dressing, but it still makes it taste good. There's tons of meat in this sandwich - definitely a plus and a good serving of lettuce to balance out the mountain of protein. 

Would I drive halfway across the city to go here? Nah... but since it's only a matter of blocks away, I don't mind scampering over there to grab another Atomic.

An alternate sandwich shop to try: Lou's Cafe on Geary and Park Presidio - blows this place out of the water!
author: Christina B.

description:
I officially popped my Gene's-Liquor-sandwich-cherry recently. Why have I waited for so long? I have a friend that lived down the street that would rave about this place and I was always reluctant. Shame on me.

I had the veggie sandwich and was stoked to see them toast the bread to order. I wholeheartedly believe that the bread can make or break a sandwich and Gene's have got it right. 
They have a great beverage selection and other such munchies to accompany your sandwich, all for a decent price.
author: Lauren D.

description:
The guys here ain't the friendliest, I'll give ya that. BUT!!! I'm not here to make conversation with them, I am here to get a delicious mouth-watering sandwich. The atomic sub, to be exact ;)

Like most liquor stores in the area, the things you find here can be found at safeway as well. Oh! But one big difference, the things here are probably 15 years old. I never touch it because it's dusty. How long do you have to leave things out before they accumulate enough dust to be a carpet for ants? Well, I usually ponder around while waiting for my ATOMIC SUB! :)

It is absolutely delicious. When I used to go to Lincoln, I'd get off the L taraval here to grab a sandwich and hop on the next one home. When I get home my sandwiches are usually still warm which is a definite plus. They're SO good that I have to get the large ones so even if I don't finish it, I'll probably want more later during the day.

I definitely recommend Gene's.
author: Erica A.

description:
I was out waiting for next door to open and remembered that one of my coworkers said that Gene's sandwiches are good.  I went over to Hamik and ordered up the Atomic Sub with everything.  I ordered the large size cut in half so I can take it home to share with the daughter.

To make a long story short, the toasted wonderfulness of the warm meat, lettuce, tomato and onion sandwich did not make it home.  I could not stop.  I quickly finished all evidence of the sandwich and wondered if I should go back for more.   Nah......I probably would have eaten that one too!  "The Daughter"  will have to be happy with a piece of fruit or something for her snack.........
author: Curtis L.

description:
Damn, I had almost forgotten about this place until I got my Yelp spam this morning.

We used to (like 10 years ago now--writing this is a total "holy shit, I'm old" moment) call this place Juice's, even though it is really called Gene's and the guy who runs the place is called Hamik. For some inexplicable reason Hamik was nicknamed Juice by my boy Vinny, which is a good name for someone who is good at giving other people nicknames. Point being, you can call Hamik (proprietor of Gene's) pretty much any name in the book and he probably won't blink an eye. Thus concludes the most convoluted paragraph in the history of the written word.

Anyhoo, you can get a very good toasted liquor store sandwich here. Not quite as good as Roxie on San Jose Ave., but a spot-on knockoff of the Sub Center in West Portal. Also I remember the beer selection sucking pretty badly (even though I was still drinking 40s at the time), but there's a 7-11 across the street.

P.S. Several years ago Gene's had a fire under mysterious circumstances, and when it reopened it was considerably nicer. Like C & C Music Factory said, it's one of those things that makes you go "Hmm..."
author: Trav W.

description: Really cheap sandwiches and the guys here are great -- really appreciate your business. Definitely a hidden gem.
author: Niran L.

description:
Definitely great sandwiches when I need a last-minute meal...

I always compare every deli to Roxie Sandwiches, and I was pretty satisfied. The bread was toasted just right, and my stomach was craving for more. 

It's a small rundown-lookin' deli, and you'll have to keep repeating yourself to the workers on what you want in your sandwich, but there's not much to complain about.

This will be my back-up deli spot when I don't feel like driving all the way to Roxie's.
author: Milz T.

description:
...AND DELI!

Friendly guy, and a good place to grab a bite while waiting for the L line on Taraval.
author: Chris I.

description: Really cool that this liquor store also has sandwiches. Love that it's just a mom & pop shop handling the business! The sandwiches were worthy of my mouth but they were just too ordinary for me to keep coming back. If I lived in the neighborhood, I would most likely come in for a quick meal but other than that, I wouldn't trek out here for them.
author: Erin M.

description:
I love this place... Nice people and great sandwiches.

I just put a serious hurt on a veggie sandwich for lunch and it blew my hair back.

The veggie has loads of fresh avocado, an assortment of veggies, cheese, and their special sauce (which is awesome) on a toasted roll.  You really can't go wrong with this place for a sandwich to go.

Sandwich, bag of chips, and a can dr pepper ~$7.50
author: Joseph H.

description:
If you blink while driving past Gene's, you'll miss it completely, which would be a damn shame because this Sunset neighborhood liquor store is a front for one of the BEST sandwich shops in San Francisco. 

I popped in here for my 2nd visit, and once again ordered the wildly popular "Gene's Atomic Sub" which consists of pastrami, turkey, and corned beef, my newly favored triumvirate of the sandwich world. You also get your choice of condiments and fixins.

For roughly $7, you get a fresh sandwich, made to order and toasted right before your eyes. What more could you ask for? Well, I'll tell you what I would ask for..... "I just wish there was more yummy meat between those warm buns!"

(Oh....you can also buy liquor here. Shhh!) Let's keep that between ourselves, mmkay?
author: Rory O.

description:
Ok read all the great reviews and decided to try in on Saturday night. 
I was hungry looking for a great sandwich in the area. I tried the Atomic Sub and yes it satified my hunger needs. But no it was not all that. I've had better and nothing stands out on this sandwich. He put some special sauce which just looked like italian dressing. Anyways, no hype here I've had better sandwiches and this was just ok. Will I return probably not. It also wasn't cheap for a large automic sub it was $8.35
author: Larry L.

description:
Update: Day old Gene's sammies are a tad soggy if you get the Special Sauce on it - but....but but but. Still delicious! 

Plus...there were 4 of us in the store when I went... the owner knew ALL of our sammies plus my boyfriend's pick and he hasn't even physically been there yet. 

Love this place! I go outta my way for a Gene's sammie and I'm never disappointed.

OH! and ...triple win for the STACKS of avocados he puts on your sammie when you ask for them... layered and stacked all the way down the sammie. YUM!
author: Katy A.

description:
Everyone likes to compare Gene's to Subcenter in West Portal, primarily because 

1) Their flagship sandwich is also called the Atomic Sub
2) There's rumored to be a family connection between the two
3) Subcenter is, you know, like too popular now, and people need a new underground cult sandwich spot.  

And Gene's, being a one-man show (what's up Hamik!) in a corner liquor store far out into the avenues, is plenty underground...for now (I don't know how much lunch traffic they could really handle if word gets out).  Of course, I couldn't try the atomic sub as I don't eat beef anymore, but the Italiano, with 3 kinds of salami, makes a fine substitute.  I'd describe it in more detail only I ate it too fast to remember much.  Note that the large can definitely feed 2 people.

Of course, living two blocks from Yellow Submarine these days renders the whole Subcenter vs Gene's debate largely moot for me, but Gene's certainly earns its place in the LSS (liquor store sandwich) pantheon.
author: Wes M.

description:
mmmmm sandwhiches are bomb, I never go anywhere else to get sandwhiches, because no one else can compare.

Love the workers!
author: Porsha A.

description:
Great sandwiches, can vary depends on who makes them.

Generally Hamik makes the best.  When he makes them, they are definately the best I've found in the Sunset.

Can't recommend buying much other than drinks and sandwiches there.
author: Andrew B.

description:
BEST SUB SANDWICHES I HAVE EVER HAD! Everything is so fresh at this place. I ordered the hot pastrami and I absolutely loved it. The bread is amazingly delicious and toasty and the pastrami is some of the most premium cuts that I have had on a sandwich. They put a ton of meat and they coat everything in a nice italian dressing which perfectly compliments the Hot Pastrami. If you are not sure about the dressing, ask them to go light or maybe give you a side because they put a lot of it. I like it but maybe some may not like so much. I don't know if they automatically put Mayo but I asked that they do because a lot of places don't on this sandwich. So if you happen to order a Hot Pastrami and they don't put the mayo.. make sure you add it! It makes the sandwich like 10 times better.

This place is not exactly where you would expect to go for a delicious Sub Sandwich. Its located way off the main streets (though Taraval St is kinda a main St I guess.. but its really not) and its inside of a FREAKIN LIQOUR STORE! I don't know why we don't have any places like this around Fremont but I sure do enjoy taking the extra drive to grab one of these subs from Gene's.  I also heard that this place lucky for lottery tickets so I grab one each time I go. Haven't won yet but I'm looking forward to when I do. 

Overall I had a great experience here. I absolutely love their sandwiches and appreciate that they do make a good sub due to the fact that so many places these days get it soooo wrong. If I'm craving a tasty sub... would I drive from Fremont all the way to this place?? Yes... yes I would. Its that good! The great toasty bread also makes it that much better.

Good Job Genes Liquor... and Deli!
author: Chris B.

description:
My usual- Atomic Sub, it has like three different meats. Its a liquor store so be ready for people buying a 40 or cigarettes or lottery tickets while you wait for your sandwich being made. Overall, the sandwich was good. The secret sauce is pretty much like a watered down italian dressing. I believe they only have two types of breads (the roll and sliced bread. I wish they had dutch crunch.

Price- About $8 bucks for the large

Time- Its a liquor store so come right in and order and they make it for you right in front of you.

Will I come back?- Yes
author: Patrick S.

description:
Getting a pastrami sandwich at Gene's was an interesting experience to say the least... 

We walked into the corner deli and there was a short line. There were 2 guys working behind the counter, one cashier (we'll call him Skinny) and a sandwich maker (we'll call him Cool). The line died down and Cool was still finishing up some sandwiches. We are the only ones left in the store.

Skinny looks at Cool. Then looks at us and back at Cool again.

He looks around the store. 

Looks back at Cool again.

Skinny: Wait, who are those for?

Cool: What? 

Stops what he's doing and looks at Skinny like Are you serious?

Skinny: There's no one else here.

Leaves counter and looks around the store. Comes back.

Skinny: Oh, nevermind. I know who it's for. He'll come back...

So Cool finishes up his sandwiches.

Skinny takes our order and rings up another customer. 

Pretty soon, the little deli gets busy again.

Skinny helps Cool start another customers order. 

Okay, you wanted the vegetarian right? Wait, you didn't want what? Wait, what?

Cool's over there just cool, calm, and collected. 

Homeboy skinny was getting all frazzled, pacing back and forth.

Cool finished up our sandwiches and Skinny started to bag them. Because he was in the middle of making someone else's sandwich he was wearing mustardy gloves and got mustard all over the the bag. He proceeded to wipe it off with a napkin but instead just spread it everywhere and made it worse. So he sighs and takes off his gloves and gets a fresh bag. Hey, at least he's wearing gloves though right?

He finally bags everything up and rings us up. I hand him a 20 and he looks at me and goes oh ho ho.. I thought this was a 100! Umm okay, I'll take it.. you can give me change for a 100! I just laughed cause he was getting really stressed.

All in all, the sandwich was pretty good. Pastrami with added avocado. Only one choice for bread but they toast it. Trust me, it tastes so much better if you're enjoying it oceanside by the beach!! 

Maybe Cool should've indulged in some of Gene's liquor to chill out a second!!
author: Angela W.

description:
mmmmm..... 

My sister told me that Gene's is the new after school hangout place for SI kids ... back in my day, we all headed to Sub Center in West Portal, so I was interested to see what the kids do these days. (I know, totally lame!) 

So my sister and I took a little field trip to Gene's. We picked up some random gummy sours, a turkey and a salami sandwich - just mayo, meat, cheese, bread and special sauce. Hopefully I'm not ruining any secret (SO DON'T READ IF YOU DON'T WANT TO KNOW) but I'm pretty sure the secret sauce is Italian Dressing. 

Our sandwiches were money, but I'm deducting one star because it was overly mayonaised. I like mayo, but it seriously had like 10 little drops of mayo all over my plate when I was done. Too much! I'm definitely going to be back though, and this time I'll order light on the mayo and probably no on the secret sauce :)
author: Jennifer L.

description:
ok, so this is the perfect example of a place on yelp getting too many extra ***** for being a dollar cheaper.

The nitty gritty truth:

- it's a cheap large sandwich

- it's a solid sandwich made with fresh ingredients

- it's just a sandwich and there isn't anything special about how it tastes


So if we're ACTUALLY rating on a scale of 1 to 5 stars, with 1 being Subway or Quizno's (i.e. total shit, DO NOT EAT) and 5 being Ike's (!@#$%^ DELICIOUS and tastes unlike any other), instead of on the standard Yelp scale, which is 4-5 stars if you just like something and it's cheap, 1 star if you got too drunk, vomited and/or got kicked out ..... Gene's is a solid 3.  Eatable and good, but not anywhere near tasting unlike any other.

The owner & employee are super friendly, and worth giving your business to, get a sandwich if you're in the area and craving a regular sandwich, but don't go out of your way to get it.
author: Greg J.

description:
THE BEST SANDWICHES IN THE CITY!  

I've eaten just about everywhere in the city that claims to have "great" sandwiches.  This little mom and pop liquor store blows everybody else out of the water.  The crispness of the bread mixed with the "special sauce" makes it the prefect sandwich.  Makes my mouth water just writing this.  I usually order the large size atomic sub, and it's big enough for my wife and I to share.  If I could give 6 STARS I would.
author: Joe C.

description:
This place doesn't look as much, but if you are hungry and want the best sandwich you can possible find in the entire Sunset district. I'll take that back. In the entire San Francisco, and I've lived here for 13 years! Tuna sandwiches ROCK! Subway or Quizno's wishes they have something that good.

Gene, You probably don't know me, but know my face, Thank you very much for making your sandwiches great and staying open all the way till 10pm. Your the BEST!!!
author: Vadik M.

description:
It is the BEST SANDWICH in the city in my opinion. 

I know why people love sandwiches from places like Ikes: big portion with tons of meat and sauce. But the downside is the bread would never be crunchy even if it's toasted because there's way too much sauce and veggie. Also, I can never finish those sandwiches without getting all messy.

Sandwiches from Gene's,however,is very neat. He gives you right amount of meat/veggie/sauce which you can actually enjoy your sandwich without using a fork. Everything is at a right portion that nothing is overpowering and the flavors work very well together.

What I like most about the sandwich is the bread!SUPER CRISPY CRUST. The bread is always toasted to perfection. Like what I have mentioned above, I don't think I have ever eaten a sandwich that actually have such crispy crust!

Most sandwich is $5.50 for regular and $7(??) for large. I have yet to try their famous atomic sub but a simple roasted beef sandwich from Gene's is already enough to wow me.
author: Ris L.

description: I've been coming here since high school. The sandwiches are surprisingly good! The bread is soft on the inside and nicely toasted on the outside, the meat and other ingredients are fresh, and the sauce brings everything together. You can choose from regular or large. There are good amounts of ingredients in the sandwich and everything is nicely balanced. The prices have stayed fairly low and the service is still wonderful. Although I enjoy sandwich spots such as Ike's, Little Lucca's, and Roxie's, I will always stay loyal to Gene's. The sandwiches are simple but delicious!
author: Lauren D.

description: I go back to Gene's every single time I visit my alma mater St. Ignatius, the sandwiches at Gene's are delicious! The L stops right outside, so it is easy enough to get there if you don't want to walk or don't have a car. There is a great variety of sandwiches and anything else you'd expect in a liquor store. I miss this place when I am away at school. Be sure to get the "secret sauce"!!
author: Emily G.

description:
A few years ago, I visited a friend up in the city and he took me to Gene's.  Apparently, lots of SI high school kids call this a regular eatery.  He told me the sandwiches were amazing but I was a little skeptical because 1. I was a much pickier eater at the time and 2. Gene's looks a little sketch, especially when I was used to living in crisp and clean suburbia, getting my sandwiches from MollieStones.  

Suffice it to say that I was wrong and Gene's is delicious.  This was also the first time I'd had my sub toasted (as I had yet to travel to college and partake in the wonder that is 24-hour Subway.)  You should check it out for lunch, if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Katharine H.

description:
After reading all the reviews about the sandwiches here, I decided to give this place a try. I am so glad that I did! The atomic sub was really yummy! I got the small size (which was $6 something...i think, large was $8 something) and it consists of turkey, corned beef and pastrami, their special sauce and with the usual tomato, lettuce (?), onion, mayo and mustard. They make the sandwich in front of you and they toast it too, which is always a plus =) I didn't eat the sandwich right away so I thought that the whole sandwich would've gotten soggy, but it didn't! I ate the sandwich about 20 minutes after I had bought it and it was still warm and the bread (which I LOVE!) was still crusty on the outside. I enjoyed every bite of it. I think next time I'll get a large, just because it's THAT good.

Caveat: If you're sensitive to sodium like I am, have a gallon of water ready. It's totally worth it!
author: Maryann T.

description:
upon moving house and thus not going to the laundromat next to the 7-11 across gene's anymore, i have not had the atomic sub in quite a while now.

however.

there is no forgetting the beautiful flavors wrapped in white paper, and the inevitable mess that happens during consumption. ace taste. leave elegance at the door, and your sauce-stained fingers and face away from your fresh laundry.

extra sauce, get the bread toasted, grab a cold drink and extra napkins, devour while chaining youtube videos or while watching a movie on your laptop as you wait for your laundry to get done, wipe fingers and face clean before handling clean clothes.

this routine will make you WANT to do laundry.
author: Eliza D.

description:
I've been coming here for 4 years.  The sandwiches are pretty good.  But the only problem I have is the quantity of the meat.  They barely give you 3 slices of meat!.  For god sake, please add more meat for your customers.  Sometimes, I feel like i'm eatting a vegetarian sandwich.

3 Stars because of barely any meat.  Would've gave this place 4 stars.
author: Steven T.

description:
The sandwiches......... are. so. good. Mouthwatering is an understatement. The whole ride home after buying one of these bad boys is a constant struggle with myself to not devour it while I drive.

And maybe I'm easily entertained, but I love the way the guy scoops the avocado onto the bread. Haha. This place is great. Extraaaa secret sauce pleeeeease!
author: Melissa C.

description:
I've lived by Gene's for 2 months now, and its every bit as tastee as my friends have told me.  The workers are awesome humans, and the sandwiches are equally as good.  Hint: get no tomato, helps w/ eatability. 
The Italiano is killer.
author: N O.

description:
Remember that episode of Friends where Joey walks around with this sandwich, and he jumps in front of Ross after they hear a gunshot (which turned out to be a car back-firing), and Ross thinks Joey saved his life but really Joey was just protecting his sandwich? Well I thought that episode was stupid... that is, until a had one of Gene's sandwiches. 

I never knew how much love a man could have for slices of tender pastrami, provolone cheese, perfectly toasted bread and oh so yummy mystery sauce. I truly believe that if my sandwich was in danger I could call upon an inner super-human strength (powerful enough to lift a small car off a baby) to punch the fool who tried to take a bite.
author: Sang N.

description: The jewel in the crown of the Sunset. I've been a proponent of Gene's since 2001. Gene's hot pastrami, everything on it with jalepenos, swiss & avocado will be my last meal on the planet even if its through a feeding tube. Gene's is generous with its toppings and meat and is consistently toasted to perfection.
author: Nicholas B.

description:
ok the word is getting out now. yelpies like subcenter. i love subcenter. only problems is exactly that, too many mofos are eating subcenter. today, i stopped by to pick up lunch. its not that i dont like kids, but this kid in front of me was driving me nuts. mustve ordered like 15 sandwiches, each with specific instructions like only mayo on half of one side. good god. the kid was about my size, would it have been wrong if i smacked him? anyways, this is the kind of day i wish i went to genes.

genes is a 'set secret. im letting you guys in on it. you cant tell from the outside, but this place rocks. sandwiches are very similar to subcenter, without standing room only policy. one of the 'sets urban legend does say that theres family ties between subcenter and genes, like my buddy hen a aka bob says in his review, but until adam and jamie proves it to be correct, itll stay a 'set legend to me. 

sandwiches and beers at one place. how can you say no?
author: Euge L.

description:
Me: "Are these sandwiches toasted?"
Hamik: *creepy smile* "All our sandwiches come toasted. Hehehe."
And thats how I fell in love with Gene's Liquor. Came here in the middle of a random day because my girlfriend wanted a taste of her childhood, so we got the atomic sub and a roast beef sandwich.
