-Atomic sub was pretty good. Salami, turkey and pastrami I believe. Might be wrong. I only got a regular size but it was filling. My main beef with the sandwich is the messiness. I know thats a lame complaint but I was eating it in the car and it gets everywhere and yeah. 
-The roast beef sandwich is amazing. Roast beef is my favorite type of sandwich and they do it justice. Long thing slices of roast beef piled thick on a warm toasted bun in vegetable layers that don't slide around. It was one of the better made roast beef sandwiches I've had. And I do consider myself to be a roast beef sandwich connoisseur.  
-The secret sauce is delicious. Its some type of vinegar based sauce. Really tangy, but works well with in both sandwiches.
-They SLATHER on the mayo. He scooped this HUGE dollop of mayo onto a spatula and paints it onto the bread. And I'm watching there, my mouth drooling but my muffin top horrified. Just be wary and ask for less if your love handles can't handle the love.
-I asked for pickles and peppers which are complimentary but don't come with the sandwiches. But he also piles on the peppers. I love spiciness but I swear, every bite I was eating 2-3 jalapenos. 
-I like the toasted bread but sometimes, if you bite into the sandwich wrong, the bread will cut the roof of your mouth. I hate that feeling!
-I think the total for two sandwiches was $12. Both were regular size and my girlfriend and I were both really full. So I can only imagine what a large would have done to our stomachs. 

Try it out! If you like sandwiches, Gene's Liquor has tasty varieties. Plus Hamik is really nice and its pretty cheap for what you get.
author: Aron L.

description:
Gene's Liquor where the guy who owns the place ain't even named Gene. Go figure! He may look like a crusty old fart that hates dealing with people but he's actually not that bad of a person. Always polite and courteous to people. And who can hate a guy that watches Al Jazerah on the toob?

I have yet to ask him what his name is but that's not really that important. As long as he gets my order right, it's golden. And how hard is it when he makes most of the sandwiches here himself? I'm pretty sure he can do this blind folded if he wanted to show off a little. Not too sure if that will work out when he gets to the oven, though...But all in all, he makes good sandwiches. Can't complain too much about them because I like what I order and what I order I like. 

Oh, and he sells Moon Pies! I haven't seen Moon Pies in forever!!! And he has both flavors in stock!!! How cool is that? And the Rocky Road candy bars? He has multiple flavors! Total Awesomeness!!!
author: Anthony L.

description:
This is the first time I've had a sandwich made inside a liquor store and I must say it was a treat (thanks Jo for the tip).  

The ingredients are not gourmet but they are fresh and for $5 (regular size), you get a satisfying sandwich packed with veggies, meats, cheese, etc.  I like how toasted the roll is - it's as toasted as I've ever received (without being burnt).  The bread to filling ratio is good - not too much bread, generous amounts of filling.  

I had the veggie sandwich with avocado, cucumber, two kinds of cheese, mayo, mustard, onions, tomatoes, lettuce and the special sauce.  The special sauce tastes like Italian dressing and it gets squirted on your sandwich. 

It's a messy experience, but Hamik gives you napkins.
author: Lolia S.

description:
The short:
-AWESOME sandwiches (Italiano is the one to get, with everything)
-Right on the L line
-Very consistent in their sandwich making

The long:
The S.O. used to live two blocks from here, and upon seeing their sun-faded sandwich sign I dared myself to go into Gene's one Saturday before heading to his place.  Unbelievable was the first word that came to my mind while consuming the Italiano, and ever since I've been a fan of this place.  The sandwiches are great, and when I have time, I will ride the L line all down here just to grab one.  My favorite is the Italiano, and it's been made the same way every time (even though different members of the family who owns Gene's make it).  If traveling to the beach or the zoo or whatever, make a trip to Gene's!
author: Stacey H.

description:
11APR08:   *****************************************************************
Read most of the reviews before heading out to Gene's tonight.  The intent was to come out here to pick up one of their highly raved about gourmet sandwiches.  I was REALLY looking forward to trying this place especially after reading all the recommendations.  I grew up with and really like the Submarine Center (SC) on Ulloa St.  (see my other review on SC) Some were praising Gene's as better and costing less than SC which was why I was excited to try this place.  I really wish this was true because as much as I like SC, I do admit that I feel their submarine sandwiches are expensive ($7-8+ !).  

After trying Gene's, I must say that I was a little disappointed.  I placed the take out order Friday before making my way out to AT&T Park to see the Giants game (what better way to see the game than with my Gene's Liquor sandwich? :)  The bread was still crunchy from being toasted but the rest of it, unfortunately, got soggy probably from the Italian dressing secret sauce and was pretty messy to eat.  

I ordered the large Atomic Submarine sandwich (which I thought was kinda funny since SC had their own "Atomic Sub" as well) and set me back approximately $8.37 (these are SC prices we're talking about!)!  The sandwich wasn't bad, the service was friendly, but wasn't what I had envisioned.  I do plan to come back and give this place a couple more tries.
author: Steve J.

description:
A very hidden spot in the relaxed sunset district.  I've been coming here for sandwiches for years now.  Popping the sandwiches in the mini oven gives it the perfect touch.  The atomic sub is a never-fail sandwich.  Every sandwich has a splash of their "secret sauce".  I've tried numerous times to see if he would divulge his secret to me, but it never works.  Its a really good spot to get a hassle free, delicious sandwich.  

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description:
BIG HUGE SANDWICHES FRESHLY MADE.

They're delicious and crammed with stuff. They totally do not skimp out on your sandwich fillings. The guy there takes his time to make a good sandwich and I've enjoyed each and every one!

EDIT 02/23/08: Get pastrami with everything on it w/ avocado. OHBABY. Soooooo gooooood. I think this might just be as good.. or better.. than Roxie's! GAHH!
author: M J.

description: ahhh...Gene's Atomic Sub!!  Been having this for years!...always a treat!!  Just recently noticed though that they raised their prices...I'm pretty sure that they raised it gradually but i didn't notice until now cuz it is $8+ for a large!  Holy...!!!
author: Patrick C.

description:
Good sandwiches, but don't look at it when he makes your sandwich. Sometimes he doesnt put on gloves and his old yellow nails are in your sandwich, and if you ask him to put on gloves he'll give you attitude. haha what a fool this guy doesnt know how to do business. his stuff is good but hes just a ____ he'll never make it big like subcenter. I rather pay a dollar or two extra at subcenter at least i know its clean and rat poo isn't in that box that he digs the bread out of.. BTW the meat is not fresh like subcenter its all microwaved in front of your face. 
and he increased the price by 50 cents.
author: Mike H.

description:
This is one of my favorite sandwich places on the Western side of San Francisco. It is a unique sandwich with a flavor and texture that I find myself craving at least a couple of times a month.

Don't let the humble surroundings fool you, these guys make a solid sandwich.

I've updated this to 5 stars because it has stood the test of time!
author: Kent C.

description:
Gene is hella cool unlike the bitchy women across the street at 7-11 who won't sell you a pack of cigs even with THREE student id's at colleges the first one being from 2001.  I aint no doogie howser *sigh*

But Gene is there with his famous atomic subs and cheap bacardi.  Although the liquor selection isn't that big, it's the closest hard stuff to Lucky's on Sloat and when you're looking to get fucked up on Skyy and you're too drunk to drive as it is... 

Thank you Gene's Liquor for making living the barren wasteland of the outer sunset a little bit more bearable.  Bonus for the terrible band that practices upstairs.
author: dr S.

description:
Pro:  Best tasting sandwiches I've come across to date (Sub Center, Quizno's, Subway, Roxy's - come try one of Gene's and go back and change up your recipe), owner, no his name is NOT Gene, is a great guy with the cutest kids!

Con:  No Dutch Crunch!  =(

I live half, yes half, a block away from Gene's, so I've had a few of his sandwiches.  First, Quizno's boast of their "toasty" sandwiches when Hamid (I think that's the owner's name...) probably schooled them on it.  Second, Hamid actually sold his secret sauce recipe to the Sub Center.  Do yourself a favor and get some Gene's.
author: Violet C.

description:
I live right across the street from Gene's.  

Some people my raise their nose at this sandwich destination (I mean we are in San Francisco with the foodie elite) But don't knock it till you try it sista.

Gene's puts up with my picky ass and my some what awkward sandwiches.  I'm one of those freaks who doesn't like condiments.  So hold the mayo and mustard pahlease.  And I'm not so much a fan of onions, pickles, or tomatoes, so none of those either.  But Gene's always manages to get my turkey, swiss, lettuce, jalapenos, and "special sauce" sandwich just right. 

If you're in the neighborhood and find yourself craving a good toasted sub, stop into Gene's and you won't be dissappointed.  Don't hate.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
I almost didn't review this place because I wanted to keep it a secret ALL TO MYSELF.  But I can't help sharing a favorite sandwich spot.  With that being said. . .

How I miss Hamik sandwiches!

We would usually go in at least once a week for these delectable lunch treats to fill us up after going too many hours without eating.  There was always plenty of meat to make the sandwich tasty and filling.  The secret is definitely in the sauce and the toaster.  Or is it in the fact that I would watch him make a fresh sandwich every single time?  Oh the toasted Hamik sandwich!  I long for its crunchiness.  (Just thinking about it makes my mouth water.)

The store itself always seemed a little on the disorganized side, but I didn't really mind.  It doesn't have a ton of stuff, but a little bit of everything - especially when I needed something little at the last minute, like an Arizona Iced Tea to go with my sandwich.

Definitely the best corner store for fresh sandwiches!
author: Heather S.

description: Get the ATOMIC SUB! Gene is a really nice guy and always makes the subs too.
author: Kyle S.

description: mmm mmm mmm. You'd better be hungry.These babys are stuffed to the max. I had the tuna with EVERYTHING (except very yellow mustard). EVERYTHING is lettuce,tomato,pickles,onion, jalapenos, avocado,cheese,mayo,secret sauce (a perfect vinaigrette )....all served on a toasted baguette. Very yum. I guess the only way to improve this luscious sub would be to use Acme bread. Be sure to have plenty of napkins on hand.
author: Bleep S.

description:
Been coming here for over 10 years!  my favorite sandwich in the city - Genes atomic sub!  Sooooo good.  Hamik is the man!  bout once a week I make sure to get my fix,  

ATOMIC SUB....Dont miss out
author: Kris O.

description:
I live a block away and am always waiting for the L in front of here. After reading several yelp reviews and walking by this unassuming place for two weeks, I decided to try a sandwich for dinner because I was already starving and didn't want to cook dinner. 

I went with the vegetarian sandwich cause the guy behind the counter wanted me to order before I was really ready and it was the last thing I had read -- avocados, yum! But then he started making another guy's pastrami sandwich and I went "damn I should have ordered that." I took my veggie sandwich home and ate it though --- and I loved it! The sauce with the ingredients and the toasted bread really hit the spot. I didn't even care that I didn't get the pastrami, but next time I'll get it just to see.

And at $5.50, the sandwich was totally affordable!

Now, if you want to shop any of the other things in there, expect to pay the premium for convenience. All the local liquor stores are like that though -- and they appear to have a fairly large selection of booze if that's your thing.
author: Katies F.

description: From the outside, Gene's is just your average neighborhood corner store.  It looks a little bit run down and not the cleanest liquor store I been too.  However, they have amazing sandwiches.  I usually get the hot pastrami sub for $5 or the $8 large one and split it between 2 people.  Its basically a toasted crusty french roll with the trimmings (mayo, mustard, lettuce, etc) piled with mounds of hot pastrami topped off with some Italian dressing. It beats any other $5 sub I ever had and I'm pretty sure most people will agree.
author: Dean W.

description:
YUM.  We'd been going there for the occasional sixer of beer, or for my babe to get smokes, for a good while, and yes, those are reasonably priced, especially for a convenience store.  But!

The sandwiches!  Oh yes, the toasty sandwiches.
I think I started with turkey, some long ago day, but the Atomic wins!  Turkey, pastrami, and corned beef.  $8 for the large size, but totally worth it.  One half now, the other in a few hours.  Nom nom nom!  ;D
Perfect for when you're too tired to make your own food, and too hungry to wait for delivery.  :P

They also have a good selection of wine, liquor, snacks, and a decent pantry section.
author: Ali W.

description: Tried the Atomic Sub yesterday.  It was solid, next time I'm trying the Pastrami.  For me this is still second to the Yellow Submarine on Irving St, which is still high praise, and if I lived out by here, I would hit this up all the time.  I used to hit this store up all the time back in the day for alcohol.  I had no idea they made delicious sandwiches!
author: Brian C.

description:
I found myself on one of those 3 am romps through the Sunset one night. I visited 7-11 for a pack of cigarettes? Who knows, maybe some Fritos. Anyways, being bored and waiting for the L to come, I peered into the closed liquor store, which I had never really noticed before. Then I saw a sign saying that they had the best sandwiches in the Sunset. Now that's a claim....

A few weeks go by and I have yet to try one of these sandwiches. Then a good friend of mine brings it up, saying that whenever he's in the Sunset that's his go-to sandwich spot. So, I trek down there and order a regular turkey sub with everything on it. YUM-TASTIC! The sauce was so good I let it leak all over my shirt without a care in the world. I went back later that week to get a Large Turkey Sub, yum-dee-dee-dum. I'm interested in trying the veggie sub too. Perhaps I shall go there today!

The only reason this didn't get a 5 star was because the guy who makes the sandwich wasn't really that friendly-seeming. He kept on interrupting his sandwich making to help other customers even though I had been patiently waiting for a while. But hey, he has a business to run, so it's all good.
author: Emerald M.

description:
I love gene's liquor for many reasons.

1. The price is much cheaper than the owner's cousin's place on West Portal (sub. center).

2. The quality of the food is matched to (sub center) without the intense crowd of people. Although he does get very busy too.

3. Parking on taraval is much easier than West Portal.

4. Friendly, always carry a conversation with the owner.

Anyways, before I list over 20 things, I would just like to say try this place if you haven't. Don't judge a book by it's cover, because that's exactly what I did. On the exterior it looks like a bad shape liquor store, but what really counts is the food right? I usually call in by phone and by the time I reach the place it's already done.
author: Austin N.

description:
Out of reluctance, I agreed to have a sandwich from a liquor store. I never understood how this shop stayed in business with 7 Eleven right across the street. But now, I know......

The pastrami sandwich with the secret sauce is delicious. Anything hot out of the oven with melted cheese is gooood. Only thing I would whine about is that they should put more meat in it.
author: Katie K.

description:
I love the sandwiches here. What I like the most is the secret sauce on the sandwich. I've been getting sandwiches here for almost 8 years since I was a freshman in high school.
Sandwich: Awesome, especially if you add avocado. Kinda messy but worth it.
Price: Used to be $5, now $6 regular.
Service: About 5 mins. If you want to avoid lines don't get your sandwich from 3pm-4pm, teens will be taking up the line during those times. You can also call ahead & order. Pick up your sandwich in 10mins.
Dinning: No seats, take out.

Try the sandwich at least once & let your taste buds tell you if you like it or not. =)
author: Marie L.

description:
I can never get sick of  Gene's sandwiches & their secret special sauce!! I've been having the same sandwich (pastrami sandwich) for about 4 years now and I'm still addicted. It's one of those hole in the wall places. You enter just expecting it's another liquor store, but can never leave without a smile on your face as you put your whole head in that paper bag with the smell of fresh pastrami dancing happily throughout your nostrils.
 
I'd go here every Friday after school right before my dance class. I'd be too scared to eat it in front of everyone because they would want to "get a   little bite" of my sandwich..Little bite?? Really?? No one just nibs a LITTLE bite. Yes, its that good. My rule: No one can touch my sandwich, unless you're truly starving...maybe. 

Minus one star because sometimes they don't use gloves to make the sandwiches..then they touch money..?! That's a little iffy. The line can get really long once the nearby schools get out, but who can blame them..the perfectly toasted yet ooozy sandwiches here are amazing.
author: Alexa M.

description: I work right across the street. This place is perfect for a sammy! Love the atomic with avocado. Cool people too. They know what I like. :)
author: Lauren L.

description:
Gene's sandwiches aren't as good as Sub Center's, but this place is a lot less stressful to be in and not to mention a lot cheaper.  And "Gene" is a pretty cool guy.  And you can get some booze while you're getting your sub!  

Who could ask for more?
author: Keane N.

description: I work right across the street. Love their sammys!  Really nice guys too. :)
author: Emily W.

description:
Being an old student from "that" high school not so far from this joint, Gene's was my regular sub place to go to. The school craved Gene's so I can only imagine how good it actually was as a freshman.

Here I am, years later, an alumni, and I must say, Gene's hit the spot with the cheap yet filling toasted subs with the special sauce. Being a "health freak" I always went with turkey, but now, I am just cravin for some Pastrami since that's what everyone else seemed to get. Gene's had the right price with the right idea. The only thing I wish Gene's had was a variety of bread. I know, it ain't sub-quality bread if its not the bread that Gene's, but I like some variety, different strokes for different folks.

Also, I've seen the guy handling money and then fixing up the subs- not particularly healthy, but hey, I'm still alive since freshman year right? Thank god for Seniors in high school when you're a freshman... Theyre actually good for something.
author: Gabe R.

description:
I like his sandwiches until one day, he started spiting in my sandwich. He was talking to himself and suddenly he said something and i saw a spit on my sandwich. he shouldn't be talking when he's making people's sandwich. that's the last time i ever bought from there again.

Have you seen how his oven looks like? It's really dirty.
author: Robin T236532i9 W.

description:
My friend lives a block away from this liquor store and one day he introduced me to Gene himself and his sandwiches. 

I never liked toasted sandwiches until I tried Gene's roast beef toasted with cheese and onions. He has all the veggies to add, but his italian dressing really makes it taste delicious. It's just a small corner store, but it is a really good quick toasty sandwich.
author: Heather T.

description:
Love the sandwiches!  Hamik is a cool guy and usually has something really interesting to watch on the television (nevermind the language barrier).  Once in a great, great while he'll get in a fight with his wife, pound some vodka and hit up the Four Deuces (bar) just up the road- it's awesome!  He is a very cool character and worth chatting up.  

Also convenient about Gene's is the L-line stop- going to a Giants game?  Grab a few beers from Hamik and suck them down on the MUNI!  I may have strayed away from the task at hand- the sandwiches are delicious, Hamik has his own special sauce and it makes all the difference.  They were toasting sandwiches long before Quizno's and Subway.
author: Joel S.

description: Gotta love a liquor store with hot sandwiches! And by hot sandwiches, I mean the best. The owner is a cool dude too. Aaaah, years of memories of waiting for the L Taraval right here :o)
author: Kelly s.

description:
If you love the Sub Center in west portal you might as well come here too! Want a nicely toasted sub with a secret sauce? Come to Genes! Sandwich's here are just as good as the Sub Center and I think they're cheaper. I guess Sub Centers secret sauce is not so secret after all.

I believe that the guy who works at Gene's used to work for Sub Center and just took his sauce with him. Don't know for sure but the sandwiches are pretty bomb. My favorites are the atomic sub or the hot pastrami. Classic subs you just can't go wrong with. PLUS you can wash it down with an ice cold YOOHOO! Not many places sell yoohoo's which is why Gene's is definitely the spot!
author: Kazuaki K.

description:
So an sandwich is just a sandwich--right?    No way.  This is the best tasting Sub in the city.  I get the veggie and it is spot on each time... and cheap.  

The usual d00ds who work the counter are grate guys, and they love what they do.
author: Johnny C.

description: wow. that was the best damn sandwich i have ever had from a liquor store. Plus the guy who owns it is super nice and awesome.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description: When my friend's took me here for the first time I thought, "Thanks guys for taking me to the corner store for a sandwich."  But afterwards, I gave them a big thanks.  Good sandwich, the large is quite filling.  I got the gold standard of all sandwiches (in my opinion) turkey and swiss.  After sometime in the magic grilling oven and some secret sauce (a type of Italian dressing I think), a masterpiece is born.  Another plus, a large selection of chips, drinks, candy and other treats to choose from.  I also like that this place is kinda undercover, I mean if my boys didn't take me there, I probably would have never gone there, so thanks friends and thanks Gene for a bomb sandwich.
author: Shane Y.

description: I love the sandwiches here and have been enjoying them for years. The sandwiches here are very similar to Submarine Center. It's also a hidden gem only a skip away from home. But recently, things have been getting a little skimp. They used to have a great meat to veggie ratio but now it's more of a salad sandwich. I'm going to take the drive and go to Sub Center from now on.
author: Eric L.

description: I come here all the time for their sandwiches. The owner and employees are very nice. The outside of the store looks a bit shady, but the inside is anything but. They know a lot of their customers by name. Sometimes there is a short wait, because the cashier usually makes the sandwiches, but it's definitely worth the wait. The owner and employees are always courteous, so you can't help but like them.
author: Cal S.

description:
This place is legit. Hamik is the man. He makes sandwiches with love and the others he are mentoring are getting there but will never reach his status. He is so awesome they should rename it Hamik's. Pastrami is the way to go. Prices are rising along with this recession. But come on now. Who can't help but love the bread, cheese, onion, tomato, meat, mayo, mustard, lettuce all toasted in less than 7 minutes. If you don't like something just ask.  I've been introduced to this place since 2004 and have been going on a monthly basis.

And to add they sell IT'S ITS ICE CREAM. San Francisco's greatest invention ever. They sell chocolate, original, mint, and cappuccino I believe. A delicious mouth watering sandwich and an SF delicacy. Truly an experience. 

Just go on a weekend or during the day when the high schoolers are still inside and nowhere to be found because when they get out it's a rush for some Hamik's Sandwiches. At least when I was in high school, that was the place to go.
author: Philbert K.

description: Pastrami Sandwich with Onions provolone cheese and special sauce, WOW! Every time it tastes better and better. Get a large one!! WOW! Best Sandwich i ever ate period.
author: Jake R.

description: This unassuming little liquor store puts together a pretty good sandwich.
author: Patrick S.

description:
This place was my saving grace when I moved into the neighborhood!  One would think you can usually find a deli sando pretty much anywhere when you live in the city, but Parkside is a little limited.  The alternative is going to 7/11 - BLUGH!

Anyway, Hamik is the man.  He is one of those guys where he acts all serious, grumpy, etc...but really is a funny dude.  I always ask to lightly toast my sando (they get pretty crispy otherwise) and after a while, he learns your preferences.  Hurry though......he about to raise his sando prices!!
author: Scott N.

description:
Gene's offers a good liquor selection as well as a good sandwich.  Things to check out at Gene's: foreign news telecast and ancient beer props.  The trusty owner, Hamik, remembers what sandwich I get when I don't order by phone.  The sandwich sizes range from a 8 to 12 inches.  All sandwiches come on a hard roll with lettuce, onions, tomatoes, mustard and the always popular special sauce.  If you can't find parking at Sub Center or can't stand the line or the price, come to Gene's.

Regular Atomic w/ chips and a soda - 8.75 no tax
author: Matt A.

description:
Awesome toasted subs at a decent price.  Not overloaded with stuff.  Good ratio of bread, meat, veggies, and sauce.  One of the best basic sandwiches I've ever had.  Love it.

The owner might not be super talkative, but he's a nice dude.  Besides, I don't really care for small talk anyways.

Sadly the price has gone up since I first started coming here from $5 to $6 for a regular.
author: Derk C.

description: Amazing sandwiches and Hamik is great! I used to live a block away and frequent this spot but 3 years later Hamik still knows me by name!
author: Megan F.

description: This is the only place i will ever get a sandwich at.. its close to my house and their sandwiches are really good! You get to put whatever you want on it.. oh what can be better than putting whatever you want on it! Its not too pricey either.. its really worth it! YUMMY! I wish they opened later.. =)
author: Heather C.

description: Really, good, GOOD, sandwiches.  I love how the bread gets toasted just enough for that satisfying crunch, and love/hate how the generous fillings get everywhere.  I admit I was a bit wary at first, since I didn't think a liquor store would have the best sort of freshly made food, but since it's right in front of where the L stops, I could always smell it!  It got to me.  And it's literally one block away from where I live.  Nice.
author: K P.

description: It's more than the secret sauce, people go here in respect to the owner that shows the utmost decorum towards everyone, for goodness sake he remembers what type of sandwich I want and I don't even go that often. Not to say he wouldn't beat your ass if you get out of line, but that's not the point. This is a well ran business; great sandwiches, service, and people.
author: Maurice T.

description: Me gusta Genes.  My little sister told me about this place... all the kids are always going to genes for a sandwich after school.  Bomb ass sandwich.     Toasted.. and sauce, much like Sub Center, and a little closer to my house.  You would never know that this place has great sandwiches unless someone told you bc its a liquor store... but yeah, try it out, you wont be dissapointed!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Its a lot like the submarine center but a little more mayo, a little less meat, and little more secret sauce aka Italian dressing. sometimes they burn the bread a bit, its funny, they never have with my subs, but everytime I bring my roomate there they burn his, cracks me up. I go here a lot and I will until I move outta the neighborhood
author: johnny s.

description: I used to always buy sandwichs from the Submarine Center on West Portal.  One day my friend introduced me to Gene's Deli, and I was hooked.  They taste just as good, if not better, as the Submarine Center.  Sandwiches are always hot, fresh, and made to order.  Hot pastrami with everything is my favorite.  They can get kinda messy when eating, so get some napkins.  Pricing is decent, $5 for a regular, and $6.50 for a large.  I remember the days when a regular was $4.50 and a large was $6.  But either way, the sandwiches are still worth it.  It's been years since I've gone back to the Submarine Center...  Gene's has better parking, better prices, and less wait time..
author: Ryan D.

description: I always get the same sandwich wherever I go.  Toasted turkey with swiss, avocado, jalapenos, and the works.  Gene's makes a great sandwich, although I had to knock off a star due to the thick slab of mayo they slop on the bread.  Sometimes the line is long, but it's worth it.  One of the better sandwich places in the Sunset.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I am on board with the Atomic Sub as well.  I agree with others that the similarities between the Sub Center at West Portal and Gene's is amazing.  If the stories are true about the relative connection, then it all makes sense.  Not the fastest sandwich but a real gem in the neighborhood.  Pick up the chips and a drink, which are a little cheaper than a typical deli but match up to small liquor store prices.
author: Glenn L.

description: If you're looking for a decent toasted sandwich for $5-8, Gene's is a spot worth checking out.  I usually have the hot pastrami with everything on it and it hits the spot every time.  It's a nice small spot to pick up sandwiches in the area.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Best value for a big sandwich in SF. Try the pastrami with cheddar and everything on it. Gene's is the best! Definitly more bang for your buck than submarine center.
author: David W.

description: I love coming here for sandwiches! not only is it one of the best places to grab a sandwich in the outer sunset, but it's affordable as well, meaning cheap! compared to other sandwich places.
author: Pudgy G.

description: Pretty good selection of booze + super good subs = A fabulous place.  Also the guy there is super nice and it's got a cozy little feeling :)
author: Tara B.

description: Best sandwiches in the sunset. The guy that makes them ( I forget his name - it's not Gene) is super nice and always remembers me and what I order even if it's been 6 months since Ive been in.
author: Risa R.

description: Took several Yelp recommendations to step in here and get a sandwich. I happened to be at the post office down on Taraval so I walked over to get a pastrami sandwich. Literally just finished eating it, and I want another one it was quite tasty. Their "secret sauce" was good. you could almost skip mayo/mustard but I had all the fixings this first time.
author: Ryan D.

description: When I drove up I couldn't believe that this was the place that got all these great reviews. When I walked in and saw the sad little "deli" right next to the cash register I almost walked out. But I said to myself, "No! Do not run away like a Frenchman!" So I didn't. I, as you all suggested, ordered the Atomic Sub. A large one. I must say it was much better than I would have guessed. Pretty large, generous toppings, plenty of meat, nicely toasted. But nothing to make a special trip for. If I were on that corner at lunch time I would get another one but I will never make a special trip to go back there. It is an okay sandwich for a little bit too much money (a large Atomic costs $8.85). If you are on Taraval or in the vicinity I would highly recommend heading up to Guerra Meat Market and getting a much higher quality sandwich for less money. But I'm still glad I know about Gene's so thanks everybody!
author: Alan P.

description: The sandwiches are pretty damn good. But the bitter, rude man that makes them takes away from the flavor. Overpriced.
author: Meg I.

description: I love Gene, he is the man. He has created a wonderful store for me to purchase beer and chips while my delicious sandwich is being made. I am a fan of the staff and the variety of odds and ends that the store carries. There have been multiple times that I have relied on Gene's for my beach picnic/roof top beers. Thank you Gene for your reliable prices and service.
author: Melissa B.

description: I love Genes. When I don't want the tasty Chinese food around the area, I get a tasty sandwich from Genes. I always get the veggie one because it's a veggie lover's dream. There's some other things to buy and he has a wide collection of beverages. One liter Coca Cola from Mexico and a large veggie sandwich makes me happier any day.
author: Myfood Y.

description: I'll tell you this, I lived at 32 and Santiago for a year and I only dropped by this place for a sandwich when I was filling my moving truck up. That said, really overrated. The sandwiches are fairly large, I'll give you that, but not particularly good. Also, it's not fresh either, so it's nothing to rave out.
author: Simon L.

description: This place makes Subcenter sandwiches and they sell liquor.  A one stop shop.  The owner has family ties with subcenter, so they are very similar.  I usually get a hot pastrami with provalone and jalepenos, water, a pack of reds, and a vega.  Hamik you get five stars.
author: Hen A.

description: I love this place! The sandwiches are really good! The owner is really nice, remembers his customers, and best of all is not cheap! The place is older, and the guys name isnt Gene, but its because the place has been in the neighborhood for sooo many years...I mean...cmon! But it is sanitary and he always wears gloves (in response to the review below). Basically...every sandwich Ive ever gotten there has been really good! But try it yourself...at least once.
author: Gayane B.

description: I used to come here all the time.  The subs are great, I usually get the turkey or pastrami, large.  However, minus 2 stars for Gene always forgetting to put the gloves on before he makes my sandwich.  One of my pet peeves is someone who handles money and then goes and makes your sandwich right afterwards.  Its just nasty and extremely unsanitary.
author: Bart W.

description: Yum Yum in my tum tum! I walked pass this place after getting my hair did across the street, and noticed the BEST SANDWICH IN TOWN sign outside. I walked in and said, "Best sandwich in town huh?" (not usually like me, but I was in the mood to say so), noticing the friendly looking man behind the counter. We chatted quit a bit, and he had told me his fave was the pastrami sandwich, and that was what I went for. I wish I was able to eat it hot, but I only had it warm about 30 minutes later. Sadly, I was only able to finish half since I was on the go as well. It was unfortunately because it was effin delicious! I don't know about being the best sandwich in town, but its up there with some of the best I'm sure. At this moment, I can truly say that I crave no other besides from this and a philly cheese steak (from god knows where). A pretty large delicious sandwich for $5.50 seems to be a better choice compared to my once-beloved Subway.
author: Elaine H.

description: Just had an atomic sub, best sandwich I could have asked for. Plus, since I'm not too fond of corned beef I asked for roast beef and he was more than happy substitute. I will definitely be coming back. Often.
author: Phaedren L.

description: I've had the pastrami on multiple occasions, but for some strange reason, a new meat caught my fancy. The tuna salad on dutch crunch is officially the best sandwich I have ever eaten. Ive had almost all the sub center sandwiches, roxie sandwiches, guerro sandwiches, Luccas, Giardino Bros, and Ikes place sandwiches and this is by a narrow margin the best sandwich ive ever had. It might have just been the time of day, or my own level of hunger, but it is what it is. I admit Ikes Place is magical and classified as art in its own right, but if you're looking for a legit sandwich and not a Picasso then Genes is the place for you.
author: Jason A.

description: I love this place. Def go for the atomic sub with everything on it, and the best part, over toasted!
author: Kyle N.

description: Hamik makes awesome toasty subs. He remembers how you like it if you're a regular. Do not push him though...I've seen him yell at customers for asking too many questions about the sandwiches. He gets a little frustrated from time to time. He's a neighborhood character. The rest of the shop is kinda sad and dingy and I hate to admit I usually go to 7-11 across the street for sodas and such.
author: L J.

description:
honestly, hamik deserves the key to the sunset. or the city.
if you are a picky sandwich person who can't handle mustard or crusts, just open your mind and let them make you one they way they do best.
because it's the best.
author: Leo V.

description: So yeah he has tasty subs but their a total knock off from Sub's! Plus everything just sits out there it doesn't look that sanitary! I don't think he even uses gloves sometimes or washes his hands after he touches the money. YUCK. His store is pretty run down, but he's nice. Skip this place and go somewhere else like a 5 minute drive to subs its worth it!
author: Colleen M.

description: hellz yea! this place gets five stars!! i always get the roast beef with everything on it! its the shieznizzal!!! i always used to pass by it but just never went in, but damn what they say is true! never judge a book by its cover.. hehe. yea... this place gets my vote anyday! its super delicious, and affordable too! mang, my mouth is watering just thinking about it! thats it, im going to the place right now to get me one! you should toO!!! hurry, before i get there first! hehe..
author: Annie Y.

description: very good sandwich. I always get regular atomic with peppers. It takes a while, especially if you order at lunch or dinner time. The regular size is huge, and the large is enough for two meals. I think they put too much sauce in the sandwich though and the sauce is too thick for my taste. I prefer roxies sandwiches but come here most of the time because my brother is addicted to Gene's pastrami sandwich.
author: Ale x.

description: Gene's is the shiz... haha warm toasted sandwiches made right in front of you. delicious, absolutely delicious, prices are pretty decent too. Lunch time it gets busy so call in!
author: Preston L.

description: genes is my favorite sandwich place. way better than subway and quiznos, etc... i usually order the atomic sub which i think is the best one. the man is very consistent with his sandwich making and always toasts the bread perfectly. lots of meat and tons of mayo, mustard. and the "secret sauce" is prolly italian dressing. pretty big sandwich also and the place is always busy with people ordering sandwiches. genes is known for the sandwiches now.
author: Cory Y.

description: Best Sandwhiches in the city... and anywhere else for that matter.  Turkey and avacado is awesome.
author: Nicholas R.

description: Don't have to go to Subs at West Portal anymore, I just go to Gene's to get my Turkey sandwich fix. YUMMY.
author: L B.

description:
not really rating the store itself....only its sandwiches.

i love genes sandwiches.  ive been going there for years and when i'm hungry and in the area and have 6 bucks on me, im always down to get genes.  ive tried only the turkey and the vegetarian and they were both hella good.  the sandwiches are big enough to get you satisfied, and they are cheap too!  (5.50 for a regular, 7.50 i think for a large)  the guy (his name is NOT gene btw) is cool.  they only have one type of bread unlike other delis but its all good because sometimes having too many choices is bad in my opinion.  and they toast their sandwiches too.  YUM!

oh and make sure to get there before 2pm or be prepared to wait in a line of high school students.
author: Shelly C.
